page.title: 03S.P.A.C.E., North Staffs
page.content: Throughout Staffordshire during August Police Officers and volunteers organise a scheme called S.P.A.C.E. This is a scheme for young people between the ages of 10 and 16. S.P.A.C.E. stands for Staffordshire Police Activity and Community Enterprise. Once the young people have registered they can join in activities such as swimming ,various sports,cinema visits, discos,rambles,day trips to resorts and places of interest.In 1984 more than 25,000 children took part.From our school this year 24 children out of 42 that are eligible have enrolled. The scheme was started by the police to help prevent crime amongst young people who are bored during the long summer holiday.Since the introduction of the scheme the level of reported crimes has fallen each year.
